intro: Torilis arvensis var. homoeomorpha, commonly known as field eryngo, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, silver-green leaves and a flowering head that produces small, yellowish composite flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and roadside areas. It has a taproot system and produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Its botanical features make it a common weed in various temperate regions.
